column4: is there any good GUI which tells about the network bandwidth that systems on the local area network are using
systems as in all other computers ? or you're just interested in your own computers network usage?
I would look into some kind of snmp solution.. there are several application for gathering the info and presenting it .. cacti is one.. there are several others
Slart:does traceroute by any chance give enough info to figure this out?
traceroute only gives you ip's and ping times afaik.. you can't tell anything about network usage from that, afaik
I think you'll have to get that info either from a switch, if all traffic passes through that switch, or by asking all the computers directly
I think tcpdump only sees traffic coming to your machine
Well, its a switch. but how do you talk to a switch
Slart:tahat is how do you get the info from switch
perhaps it talks snmp? is it a big impressive switch you payed lots of money for? =) if that is the case it probably does
what's the purpose of this? limiting bandwidth at the office? keeping your kids in line at home? =)
Slart:Sorry if i offended you. but i thought only routers have a identity and switches dont....and i dont have kids :) its for learning something
no offence taken .. what do you mean by identity? ip-number?
routerse usually have an ip.. yes.. some expensive switches have that too.. so you can setup stuff and get just the kind of information you're looking for
